ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The person_organization_select type allows for the designation of an , a
or a .
An address is the information necessary for communicating, using one or more communication methods.
an organization-defined address for internal mail delivery. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number of a location on a street. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the name of a street. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number of a postal box. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the name of a town. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the name of a region. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: The counties of Great Britain and the states of the United States of America are examples of regions.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the code that is used by the country's postal service. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the name of a country. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number at which facsimiles may be received. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number at which telephone calls may be received. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the electronic address at which electronic mail may be received. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number at which telex messages may be received. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
the
that specifies the name of the location identified by the address.
the text that specifies the uniform resource locator associated with the address.
ext_description.note: The format of uniform resource locators is defined in IETF RFC 1738 [4].
ext_description.example: URLs are used to identify items such as world wide web sites and file transfer protocol (FTP) servers.

ext_description.p: At least one of the attributes shall have a value.
ext_description.note: A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An organization is an administrative structure.

ext_description.p:
the
that distinguishes the organization. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
by which the organization is known.

the
that characterizes the organization. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

An organization_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
with a description of their relationship.
Each department of an enterprise, and the enterprise itself, may be regarded as individual organizations. The fact that the departments are a part of the whole enterprise may be represented using this entity.
The role of organization_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

the
by which the organization_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the organization_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An organization_role is a purpose for an organization and provides identification and description of the purpose.

the
by which the organization_role is known.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the
that characterizes the organization_role. The value of the attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to organization_role as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

ext_description.p:
Each organization_role shall be the
in at most one .

The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.
A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An organization_type is a recognized kind of organization.
A national standards body is a type of organization.

objects is established by the declaration of a subtype of
that references an
via its items attribute.

for one or more organizations.

An organizational_project is a project for which one or more
entity data types are responsible.

that characterizes the organizational_project. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An organizational_project_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
with an identification and description of their relationship.
The role of organizational_project_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

the
by which the organizational_project_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the organizational_project_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent up on the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A person is an individual human being.

ext_description.p:
the
that distinguishes the person.
ext_description.note: The identification of a person is usually context dependent.

The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
ext_description.example: In the USA a person's id would be his or her social security number whereas in the United Kingdom it would be his or her national insurance number.
ext_description.note: The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the person's surname. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the first element of the person's list of forenames. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the person's other forenames, if there are any. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the
that specifies the person's social or professional standing and appear before his or her names. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the
that specifies the person's social or professional standing and appear after his or her names. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Either the last name, first name or the last and first name shall be defined.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A person_and_organization_role is a purpose for a person_and_organization and provides identification and description of the purpose.
The role of a
could be 'buyer' in the context of the
where he/she works and it could be 'customer' in the context of the
from which he/she purchases goods.

A position_in_organization is a specific function or job performed by a person in a particular organization. It is defined by responsibilities and activities. A position that is not fulfilled by a person is a vacancy.
The chairperson of SC4.

that distinguishes the position_in_organization.

A position_in_organization_type is a generic function or job that is performed in organizations.
Technical Director is a position in a company.

objects is established by the declaration of a subtype of
that references a
via its items attribute.

The acyclic_organization_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either an
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
for which the function is searching in the
attribute of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.

or any of its subtypes.

This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

to be checked.

that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.
